de.notIOC.configuration
Class ConfigProperty

java.lang.Object
  de.notIOC.configuration.ConfigProperty

public class ConfigProperty
extends java.lang.Object

A ConfigProperty holds informations about one configuration part.

The object will be constructed by using the node of xml schema. After that text or attribute values are available.

Author:
Dirk

Constructor Detail

ConfigProperty

public ConfigProperty(java.lang.String nodeName)
               throws NotIOCException
Initialization of the ConfigProperty by nodeName.

Parameters:
nodeName - Is the xml path to a tag within the configuration. E.g. scheduler.chains.chain
Throws:
NotIOCException
Method Detail

getAttribute

public java.lang.String getAttribute(java.lang.String attributeName,
                                     java.lang.String defaultValue)
Delivers the attribute value of the property.

Parameters:
attributeName - Name of the attribute. E.g. chain here is the attribute < use chain="true" >< /use >
defaultValue - If no value is found the default value will be returned.
Returns:
Found attribute value or defaultValue

getText

public java.lang.String getText(java.lang.String defaultValue)
Delivers the text value of the property.

Parameters:
defaultValue - If no value is found the default value will be returned.
Returns:
Found text value or defaultValue

getAttribute

public java.lang.String getAttribute(java.lang.String attributeName)
Returns the attribute value of the attribute with attributeName.
If there were found more elements than one for the config property the first found attribute will be delivered here.

Parameters:
attributeName - The name of the attribute
Sample: < param key="123" >< /param > // key is the attribute name
Returns:
Value of the first found attribute with the attribute name. If no element contains such a attribute the method delivers null.

getText

public java.lang.String getText()
Returns the attribute text of the attribute.
If there were found more elements than one for the config property the first elements text will be delivered here.

Returns:
The simple text of the first element. If no element contains a text the method returns null.

getAttributeList

public java.util.List<java.lang.String> getAttributeList(java.lang.String attributeName)
Returns a list with the values of the attribute with attributeName.

Parameters:
attributeName - The name of the attribute
Sample: < param key="123" >< /param > // key is the attribute name
Returns:
List with all attributes with the attribute name. Values for not existing attributes are a String with size 0 ("").

getTextList

public java.util.List<java.lang.String> getTextList()
Returns a list with the text of every element.

Returns:
List with text for all elements. If an element has no text a String with size 0 ("") will be inserted.
